result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were canceled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Russell W Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The deft shall commit no violation of criminal law to the level of probable cause "probable cause" shall be the level of proof needed to sustain the sufficiency of the criminal complaint of a misd, or that level of proof needed to sustain a bindover for trial if a felony.
Current bond conditions shall remain in effect during the life of this Agreement.
If the DCA is not revoked, the charge shall be dismissed with prejudice.
No revocation may take place without a hearing before the Court with notice served upon all parties.
Deft specifically waives her right to a speedy trial, disposition or any applicable statute of limitations to the charge covered by this DCA.
In the event the expiration date of this DCA has passed, nothing in this DCA or the laws of the State of WI shall prevent the State from seeking revocation of this DCA if the State has filed a motion to revoke this DCA prior to the expiration date.
Deft agrees to maintain his/her current address with the Clerk of Courts office.  Any change shall be updated with the Clerk of Courts office within 72 hours of the change.  The defendant further agrees that any court notice mailed to the most recent address he/she has on with the Clerk of Courts office is notice for any further court hearings on this case.
Deft shall comply with all probation rules and regulations of the supervision ordered in this case's other conviction(s).
Defendant agrees to have AODA assessment w/60 days of approval of this agreement, Provide proof of evaluator, compled w/the recommendations of that assessment.

If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia
